block.p: SOLOMON-PAGE GROUP, New York, a temporary staffing and executive recruitment agency, said it agreed to be acquired in a management buyout by three top executives for about $21.8 million, or $5.25 a share.
PUGET SOUND ENERGY, Bellevue, Wash., a utility company, agreed to buy the Utilx Corp., Kent, Wash., which primarily installs underground cables, for $50 million in cash.

SOLOMON-PAGE GROUP, New York, a temporary staffing and executive recruitment agency, said it agreed to be acquired in a management buyout by three top executives for about $21.8 million, or $5.25 a share.
PUGET SOUND ENERGY, Bellevue, Wash., a utility company, agreed to buy the Utilx Corp., Kent, Wash., which primarily installs underground cables, for $50 million in cash.
CHECKERS DRIVE-IN RESTAURANTS, Clearwater, Fla., said it sold 51 Rally's hamburger restaurants to Altes L.L.C., Boca Raton, Fla., a privately held franchisee, for $16.4 million.

PENN TRAFFIC, Syracuse, which operates a supermarket chain in the Eastern United States, said it would buy back as much as $10 million of its common stock, or as many as 4.29 million shares, which would be 11 percent of its outstanding stock.
